bow: car rides from hell 10 month old not looking for advice because feel like ve tried everything under the sun to stop my baby from hating his car seat and car rides usually car rides go smoothly when someone is sitting in the back with him and obviously try to only get in the car when it his nap time he usually good about falling asleep in his car seat but life doesn revolve around my baby sleep schedule sadly today we were stuck in traffic on the way home for an hour and 20 min into the ride he vomited from crying so hard stopped cleaned him and played some videos for him but after that he yelled at the top of his lungs the rest of the ride this has happened before but instead of turning into complete anxiety riddled momma after realized nothing was going to make him calm down rolled down the windows and turned up my music nice and loud and took deep breath just focused on the music and driving relatively calmly the rest of the ride now home and after bit of wine and warm shower with my baby we are safe at home guess wanted to vent but more importantly nobody told me it was okay to ignore your baby but it is especially when you are in situation where you need to remain calm and focused and as long as baby is safe it okay hope this helps someone because wish someone had told me 10 months earlier you got it you are doing great job your health is important too my son was the same it sucked would get so full of anxiety and stress and there was nothing to be done sometimes you have to leave the house sorry baby he eventually grew out of it but yes it sure does suck and did put on happy music and took deep breaths and just white knuckled til we were at our destination ugh so proud of you for being able to find your version of calm while this was going on that is the most stressful thing while you are driving we found out that my daughter was doing this because her car seat irritated her spine we had two different type of car seats she was conditioned to cry in both because she knew she hurt when she was in the car seat turns out it was just the one in my husbands car we would check her back every time and it would have red mark in the same spot but the one in my car was totally fine that was an unusual situation though but might be worth taking look most kids just hate the car seats without cause though so it probably that man remember when we moved cross country and our daughter was months old had to drive with my right arm rocking her car seat the whole way sure it wasn safe but it was the only way to keep her from crying that interesting my baby was the opposite he scream and cry his entire waking life unless he was in the car stopped around months you re doing great job it ll end eventually much love to you thank you proud of myself too ll definitely be looking into seeing if it could be something in the car seat that could be making him uncomfortable but doubt it sorry your baby had to go through that heard so much about babies falling asleep in the car also tried to time it for naps etc it was hell my baby doesn go to sleep anywhere but her crib and she will let me know she be shouting at me from the stroller or car seat probably like what the hell lady this is my naptime get me home however she is now totally fine with toys back there during her regular awake time maybe yours is like that too anything worth shot right :gentle hug baby shark pandora station has been life saver ❤️ my son used to hate getting into the car seat until taught him how to climb into it himself at around before that would make sound effects like binkabonk we don want to bonk your head getting in that helped turn the negative experience and actually bonking his head into positive one thanks for the support my baby was like this for the first 3months so can definitely imagine what you had to go through sending lots of love to mommas like yourself my son did the same thing for about months then he stopped now he only fusses if he has no toys in reach is asleep and we re stopped like bad traffic or drive thru for more than about minutes it is absolutely 100 ok as matter of fact it was the safest choice you can make when my lo was an infant she also hated her carseat and screamed the entire ride to and from daycare every day eventually did exactly what you did turned up the music until coukdnt hear her crying anymore it the only way got home with both of us in piece hang in there hope it gets better soon solidarity mine is ok for while and then is just done it doesn even really help to have someone in the back seat with her ve also rolled my windows down and turned the music up sometimes it all you can do to get home safely and with some sanity left this is super helpful thank you maybe get him one of those toys you put on the seat they re meant for play pens but you can rig it to the car seat it has little mirror on it which babies usually love needed few hundred of these today you re the real mvp ve tried so many toys so far he into one that has driving wheel and mirrors but when he upset even his most favorite things he doesn even want to look at he turns into baby hulk lol think we as moms feel like we must always be there to make our kids feel better—yet sometimes there no practical way to make them feel better in the moment in similar situations it helps to remind myself that my baby is safe cared for and the circumstances are temporary—even if she crying she okay darn wonder what makes babies hate certain car seats car rides stay strong mama my year old hated car rides as baby it was really stressful taking him out because he would just cry so badly the only thing we could do was just reassure him he was fine then let it go he eventually outgrew it by then we found out he just did like to be confined he hated being stuck in one spot once he was mobile he was so much happier car rides got easier because he realized he be able to move again once we stopped this was my baby until switched to the convertible style car seat she can still be fussy in it but it improved dramatically it been night and day good luck mama hope you find your fix understand exactly where you re coming from my son who is now 15 years old was the same way everyone who rode with me used to give me hell because everywhere we went would be shifted in the seat to where had one hand on the wheel and the other arm reached behind me to hold his hand for some reason that was the only way he would settle down on car ride he was very attached to me but thankfully he grew out of it at around years old probably around the time he started front facing sorry do have any advice you re doing all you can so keep on keepin on momma my friend had this issue with her baby he screamed non atop on every car ride she finally turned his car seat around and it took care of it know it not recommended to have them forward facing at this age but might be worth trying if it hard for you to drive safely when he so upset she had hard time you did well baby screaming in the car is such stressful thing using white noise is the only thing that helped my second baby would just find an empty radio station and blare it this third kid prefers metallica tho ¯\\\ am so proud of you for being able to calm yourself down for the drive am still struggling to not get panic attack every time this exact same thing happens you go mama this happens with my month old too afraid to go anywhere far from home alone with her right there with you my baby hates the car seat and avoid going places because of it listening to his blood curdling screams makes me sweat thank you for this reminder and good job you ll get there too appreciate the advice anyways know they eventually grow out of it but in the meantime just have to try to keep my self sane have you had baby ears checked if they re not draining the way they re supposed to the reclining position from the car seat can really bother ears yup my baby hates the car seat walker stroller and basically anything that keeps him constrained he very free spirit just ready for him to walk so he can have the independence he wants hugs my 6yo and 5yo were like this the first year of their lives you have thought their car seats were made of lava the way they screamed so glad we re past it was having mild baby fever today but it instantly gone now that those car seat scream fest memories are fresh on my mind lol hoping your little one gets past this stage soon for your sake and theirs gah mine was like that too he did this until he was big enough to be forward facing and then when he could see me and see what was going on outside he was much better in the car now sometimes he so quiet think he asleep but he just watching out the window you ll get there eventually seems like it takes forever though good for you wish was able to achieve that level of zen with my first born in the car dreaded every single trip strangely he turned 11 years old today and he still complains about the car earlier we were headed to surprise for his birthday and we got in the car he said well how long is the ride ugh just get in the car child lol that said ignoring the obnoxious complaints from preteen is hell of lot easier than ignoring the screams of an infant seriously good job mama so very very true thank you this post gave me hope that someday might be able to do this as well thanks lot for sharing yeah also always do fun countdown also tell him every time we are going on an adventure always good luck my 10 month old son has also entered the hate the car seat phase he starts freaking out the second you put him in it and he strong enough now to push himself out once we get him strapped in he calms down but his tolerance for car rides has drastically declined just the other day we were stuck in horrible traffic on the way home and he cried hard for the next 20 minutes tried the pacifier tried music tried toys tried singing eventually realized that he just wanted out of the car seat hell wanted to get out of the car too so there was nothing could do for him until we got home so turned up my podcast and did my best to ignore him so could focus on driving us home it sucks but we survived my little girl did the same it hard to not focus on the screams while you drive she grew out of it don know what changed but just one day she stopped and hasn cried since although now saying it probably jinxed myself my son was the same if rides lasted more than 10 minutes purely by happenstance we found out that playing immigrant song by led zepplin would calm him down in heartbeat and as long as we kept playing it would keep him that way until he fell asleep we re talking hour stretches of robert plant aahhhh ah worth it he 19 months now and it still works when he especially fussy this message is so necessary my daughters only weeks and she scream cried from the highway exit ramp to our house was shaky and crying by the time we got home will definitely keep this in mind the next time we go for drive this is so true thanks for sharing have learned to ignore work around babies unsolvable cries tad earlier than you did primarily because my kid is simply big crier who cried at every bit of disturbance told the pedia this and he told us to just do mind the crying as no kid has died of merely crying lol his statement is kind of an exaggeration but get his point and appreciate how he is trying to comfort us new parents but just to make you feel better you actually have it better than me since at least you are alone with your crying baby so you can do what you think is best without anyone bugging you am with my mother in law most of the time and ca even begin to tell you how annoying it is when she panics everytime the baby cries she wants the baby to just always be in happy place but we all know that that just impossible to always achieve understand that she is just trying to be helpful and that she has nothing personal against me but want to be left alone in dealing with my baby as love my kid so much that will always give her the best could these people who meddle with how parents parent their kids are some of the most unpleasant people to be around til my month old is the only baby who ahtes his car seat he certainly the first baby *i ve* ever met like that think he gets too sweaty in it if he in it longer than couple minutes his back gets drenched in sweat the crying with my first son was torture when drove even if was only few miles would pull over lot and try to calm him or nurse him because it was so darn stressful on me started giving him baby snacks to keep him busy and that helped bit until he could watch cartoons on my phone or ipad second kid hardly ever cries in the car because he got his brother back there with him to keep him occupied my youngest stopped hating car rides when we switched from an infant seat to an upright one rear facing and he could see out the window found one with low weight requirement and switched around 10 months oh my gosh have to hold my daughters hand to calm her down in the car super uncomfortable though when we plan adventures we will draw map of where we are going to go and doodle things that we will see along the way then we re always on the lookout for the next thing one of my twins was exactly like this until she could forward face from then on she loved car rides used to do exactly the same thing turn up the music and just focus on it until could get her out of the car good job mumma way to go finding your zen in rough moment at year old mines developed the reputation of the most unhappy baby ve ever seen in car its crazy always have snacks drink toys binky eventually nothing works so just turn up the music and sing for my sanity we travel to see my parents every few weeks and employ the exact same strategies as you if there two of us one will sit in the back to keep him entertained but if it just me and he goes into overdrive melt down mode it music up and windows down especially if there no safe stopping places he 18 months now so we ve started putting some of his favourite shows on the ipad for longer journeys which has worked great just need to get one of those headrest holder thingies maybe you could do the same and put on super long youtube video of sing long nursery rhymes fair do to our midwives and health visitors in the uk wales at least they told me as long as baby is safe then its perfectly fine to ignore them and take some time to collect yourself as its better than lashing out and doing something you ll regret or resenting yourself for thinking awful things etc so easy to be frustrated with lack of sleep and baby so you do you mama that baby needs you to look after them think the model makes difference for my own 10 month old the bucket car seat and our spare convertible which doesn adjust very nicely which we just took on vacation with us cause lots of crying we used the main one graco extend2fit today with some trepidation yet not peep my son has been the exact same since he was born he just turned two weeks ago have no advice unfortunately since we also seem to of tried everything but here an observation we went on holiday for his birthday and had to take uber with car seats the car seats were forward facing and what do you know he loved it he was whole other baby unfortunately upon returning home and being back in his rear facing car seat he back to how he was sigh only another year until he can face forward think this is my 10 month old too though the carrier is acceptable take the bus lot more these days my baby favourite is chilliwack fly by night classic rock ftw that when the real fun starts often compare him to rabid animal nowadays say that with love but if he could he be living free in the woods our daughter is doing this too get freaked out and stressed and angry because she kust plain hates to lie down in her car seat and am hoping for the moment she can sit so can move her to the other one we have from our 4yo she is learning to crawl and sit and just hates to lie down even at home it making us crazy wish could upvote this hundred more times there is lot of pressure both internal and external moms face to make our kids feel better or even to just be *attempting* to make them feel better myself have this inescapable inner voice to *do something* whenever my kid is crying have to remind myself every time that it ok for my child not to be happy 100 of the time in fact it even more than ok because my kiddo needs to learn that not everything in life is rainbows and sunshine and that sometimes we just have to sit in car seat for 30 minutes while we run errands because that life hey my son was the same he grew out of it around 13 months then we went on 2000 mile road trip at 17 months and now two months later he actually asks me to go in the car every day sometimes multiple times hang in there babies be crazy this my lo haaaated the car until we switched her to pricey convertible car seat and it was like magic went from screaming nonstop the whole time to tolerating 15 hour road trip with minimal crying this and put mirror where she could see out the window britax boulevard saved my sanity and amen to its ok to ignore an upset baby when know they are fed dry and safe try switching to well padded convertible car seat it was magic for mine that sounds like terrible thing to go through sorry you had to but you handled that like boss and swear to you that was far more traumatic for you than it was for your baby it harder when they re younger as they age it easier to ignore the cries when you need to but hearing your newborn cry is hair raising good luck and god speed thank you it happened again today so was more than prepared it just sucks that car rides have to be this way but that life
